target.message: FLOATING PATCH: Canarification™

WIP: add update-notifier & use it

The cli bin script now runs the update-notifier module after
it has decided we're running in a good node version. We do not
yet customize the output in any way.

Marking as WIP so I can get some feedback about whether I did
the bundled deps correctly.

target.message:
lifecycle: split node_module path parts properly

In lifecycle scripts, any `node_modules/.bin` existing in the heirarchy
should be turned into an entry in the PATH environment variable.
However, prior to this commit, it was splitting based on the string
`node_modules`, rather than restricting it to only path portions like
`/node_modules/` or `\node_modules\`.  So, a path containing an entry
like `my_node_modules` would be improperly split.

Fix #13456

test: Add test ensuring bundled deps of scoped packages work

Credit: @NatalieWolfe
PR-URL: https://github.com/npm/npm/pull/14324
tackisfy test/tap/install-scoped-link.js
STATUS: refactoring getting shrinkwrap from tarballs, with the intent of storing those extracted shrinkwraps in the cache.
error-handler: Output errors using console.error
WIP: Get prefer registry from cli over scope-based-registries

*: Switch from mkdirp to correctMkdir to preserve perms and owners

Switch to correctMkdir as much as possible to ensure that permissions on
directories are correct.
test: Remove network dependency from legacy-bundled-git test
travis: Enable network tests in travis again
STATUS: Probably undesirable. Magically installs bundled deps in 1.x compatible manor but only if they were already flagged as bundled. Works for updates, but new modules, no one uses --save-bundled
test fixup
dedupe: Refactor to use tree manipulation
experiment: install-as-if-this-is-fresh-and-there-is-no-node_modules-yet
Try merging the install steps, putting build after installs

token: Fix CIDR list processing to handle comma separated items correctly

This got broken by having the config-type set to Array.  When it was a
String, it worked correctly.

error-message: Fix messaging for 401 errors that lack a reason

Prevously they were falling through to 404 handling and being printed as:

npm ERR! 404 Registry returned 401 for DELETE on …
wip

wip: Fix preinstall in a systemic way:

The problem it was having was that it was running `preinstall` with a
computing staging folder, but for the top level module and for bundled
dependencies, this wasn't the correct path. This corrects that
by keeping track of the actual current location of the module on disk
in `extract` and `finalize`.

token: Fix token revocation when otp is required

Previously, due to a bug, we didn't wait for token revocation to complete
before printing success. Further, if token revocation required an otp then
we didn't prompt for one.

Policy is that OTP _shouldn't_ be required for revocation, but allowing for
it should the registry require it is harmless.
test: Flat installs are ok
deps: Use shrinkwrap root for relative pathing
test: Ensure optional status is saved to lock file
outdated: Make wanted respect latest interaction w/ semver
profile: require password to change email
wip

fetch-package-metadata: Ignore invalid dep vers

That is, if the registry returns a list of versions some of which are
invalid, skip those when picking a version to install.  This can't happen
with registry.npmjs.org as it will normalize versions published with it, but
it can happen with other registries.

Credit: @gregersrygg
Reviewed-By: @iarna
PR-URL: https://github.com/npm/npm/pull/10869
(squash) Change implementation to do range checking for matching dev deps
fixup: add progress bars, fix review bugs (to be squashed)

prune: Fix unpruned and incorrectly pruned dependencies

Fixes: #15669
install: Remove unused isLink function
bump up the limits a bit

install: Load shrinkwrap before arg metadata

If you run `npm install modulename` it should, if a `npm-shrinkwrap.json` is
present, use the verison found there.  If not, use the version found in your
`package.json` and failing that use `latest`.

Without this patch the first check was being bypassed because version resolution
was being done prior to loading the shrinkwrap, and so checks to match the shrinkwrap
version couldn't succeed.
shrinkwrap: save requested ranges not versions

install: Handle packages without install metadata gracefully

Currently the only way to get these is to use yarn.

What this means is that we:

Leave them untouched if you didn't as us to do a full install.

Upgrade their metadata if you DID ask us to do a full install.

While: Not messing with a lock file that only has version fields except for
modules we touched.
npm-shrinkwrap@8.0.1
test no-global-warns: Use clean env, allow prerelease node warning
npm: Add timing diagnostics on --loglevel=timing

Update minimatch to 3.0.2 to get fix for ReDOS vuln.

Fixes: https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/13387

Credit: @isaacs
install: Use gently-rm consistently over rimraf
Use webpack "production" mode which enables minification by default

add note about npm/cli

oops. missed a spot.

target.message:
update tar to latest v3

This makes `portable` tar creation more portable, by ignoring Directory
mtime values, and fixes a bug where `fs.open` errors would not be
properly handled.

test: tweaking git-races test to maybe work on appveyor

This really shouldn't be going to the network like this
but I would need to take more time to carefully reproduce
this with local repositories.

It's really icky that we're relying on an external git repo
owned by someone else to pull this off.

The actual fix in this patch is just to bypass ssh key errors
that happen in AppVeyor. I'm not sure why Travis doesn't have
this issue, but that's probably because Travis does its own
ssh key business?

shrinkwrap: fix scoped dependency resolution from from

346bba1 broke the way shrinkwrap `from` got parsed.
Because of the way the `lookup` function here is treating
it as a version, the specified was being resolved as a
local package in the current directory.

This brings back the URL check to protect against this case,
which was only happening for scoped packages
